data.title: In a two year span this restaurant went from 5 stars to 2
data.text: Two years earlier we gave this restaurant 5 stars while praising their service and wonderful lobster bisque....Both items have reached a terrible low....The service was extremely slow even though the place was almost empty...The lobster bisque was a complete new recipe that tasted like it came from a can....We ordered a half dozen oysters on the half shell....when they arrived they were about the size of a quarter...We also order a side of creamed spinach and after 30 minutes had elapsed we were told by our waiter that the side was no longer available....I ordered a 6 ounce filet mignon that had to be a notch just above select....at 42 big ones....Wife had a lobster tail at $48 big ones that was hardly edible....We had a bottle of MB Luca cab at 65 big ones with out total meal costing #249.00 before tip....We don't mind coughing up the cash when we receive excellent food and service but this time Morton's was a complete rip off.....

data.title: What a find!!  A great dining experience - we were treated like royalty
data.text: We arrived early(5pm)the restaurant didn't open for dinner until 530PM but, we were greeted like old friends by the bartender, offered a beverage and spent the time talking.  They really make you feel welcome.  Then John F. our waiter went out of his way to make our dinner extra special making recommendations and explaining all that Morton's had to offer.  The entire wait staff worked as "one unit" to use the phrase "well oiled machine" would be an understatement and to top it off the Manager came by to see how things were going.  WOW!  Very impressive and the food was excellent done perfectly.  What more superlatives can I use.  Go EAT!

data.title: They never disappoint
data.text: You know the drill... The most accommodating staff and the steaks are cooked to your exact specifications. Also try the shrimp appetizer.  And the desserts will never disappoint

data.title: Always Excellent
data.text: With Morton's you always know that you are getting the best steaks available.  You can expect to pay $50-$75 for a choice steak...but you will remember it for weeks.  We went for a birthday dinner for my son. They customized the menus with his name and made it a special evening.  I was only disappointed that they didn't bring him a piece of cake for his birthday. The service is excellent and the steaks are always outstanding. Try the lobster mac and cheese for a real treat...amazing.

data.title: Bad food
data.text: Usually this place hits the mark but today it was terrible. The steak was burned, the waitress never came by the table to ask if everything was okay and the hostess that seated us didn't say a word to us. This place is going on my ban list for a while.

data.title: Good Food but Pricey
data.text: The restaurant has a formal appearance, which is exactly what we wanted. Two drinks, two entrees, shared salad & side, tax, and tip added to $163. My wife's filet mignon with scallops and shrimp was very good. My short rib with pasta portion was large, but flavor just okay. The salad was essentially lettuce and the spinach side had mushroom buttons -- both were $13 each and reasonably tasty. Overall our experience was above average, but there was nothing exceptional. Next time we fine dine it won't be at Morton's. I should, however, mention that weeknights their bar has reasonably priced cocktails for a high-end restaurant.

data.title: Excellent - Manager exceeds customer service
data.text:
We dined here on a recent Saturday evening.  Waiter was Derek and he was terrific.  The bus person was not terrific.  I asked 3 times for water and for a slice of lemon - nothing.  Then had to beg for some butter.  The final straw was my husbands steak being undercooked (for his liking and not what he ordered).  I walked to the managers' desk, Olga and informed her of our displeasure.
She immediately came over, and calmly created our evening of pleasure - she assessed the situation and smoothly took ownership of the situation.  She removed both our meals and offered some other appetizers to enjoy whilst our steaks were being cooked.  (we did not avail).  Both our meals were brought back out together and were true perfection.  We truly appreciated that she understood the desire of couples to enjoy their meals at the same time.  We were offered generous compensation. Olga was the epitome of professionalism and I hope that her senior management recognizes this.  Because of her, we will not hesitate to recommend and return to this particular Mortons'.

data.title: Good with hiccups
data.text:
We were celebrating a bday and asked for a booth when reservations were made..after drinks in the bar we approached hostess to be seated..the place was not even half full.. at least 3 booths open and I'd say 20 tables..i kid u not..the hostess walked 2ft and started to seat us at the most exposed table right beside the hostess stand..I was not happy and said we asked for booth and she immediately took us to one.  
I was disappointed they don't do the tableside menu of showing the steaks anymore .The waitress was very cordial and nice but she never mentioned any specials we had to ask if their were any and that's when she told them to us..

All the food was very good and very expensive.. I went there only because the birthday person wanted it.  
There are much cheaper places to go and food and service is just as good

data.title: Great EXPERIENCE
data.text: What a nice evening we had at Morton's,we were seated in a nice booth and our server Tommy took over and brought us a nice bottle of wine to start the evening.There is a nice ambiance about this restaurant and I enjoyed watching the chef's cooking behind us. You have to go there hungry because the portions are huge.We had a Fillet and a Dirty Pork Chop,the Fillet was cooked perfect and the Chop had to be 2 1/2 inches thick and so tender and delouses. For sides try the Brussel Sprouts they are excellent and so was the Caesars Salad.For desert we had Key Lime Pie and Chocolate Mousse.Over all a great night at Morton's.

data.title: Fabulous Happy Hour...Bar Bites are where its at!!
data.text:
I went here with my wife recently. For some reason Morton's is promoting happy hour at the bar all night. They have a select menu for this deal. However, all the food is delicious. We personally indulged ourselves with their fresh baked bread, Tuna Tacos, 
parmesan truffle fries, crab cake BLT's, Filet mignon trio, and a glass of wine all for $50! You can't beat the price for the amazing food and great value. The service was great and the bartender Alexis was super friendly and efficient. 

You can of course order a la cart off the regular menu, but my wife and I wanted to sit at the bar and enjoy this happy hour menu. 

ENJOY!

data.title: SURPRIZING GOOD
data.text:
Usually, I only like Morton's for the power hours, but this location is far better than Coral gables 

Steak great, service great, wine great

The place is done well and I will come back

data.title: Should close down
data.text:
Dinner started fine; ordered the bone in filet for me medium; came out totally rare; sent back for the chef to correct; came back rare again; no apology from the Managers; when asked about it, the most lousy, totally non service related response was that they took it off the check. Dining is not about food but about a family experience; one of the Managers started screaming in the dining room that the steak was voided...??? Service recovery is not part of Morton's culture. We live here and spend a lot of money on dining; this has NEVER HAPPENED. This restaurant should close down.
Very embarrassing; by the way, we do not need a free meal from anyone; we are fortunate enough to afford great meals at Valentino, Casa Di Angelo, YOLO, S3, Steak 954, Burlock Coast, Lobster Bar and a lot of others.
A disgrace for our community; just bad!

data.title: The 'Chain Steak House" experience...as good as it gets.
data.text: Nice ambiance, professional level service, well prepared food, and no surprised - just what one would expect at a successful national chain restaurant..  They have their own take on Oysters Rockefeller, which was better than the average.  The saboyon on the desert menu was an excellent and relatively light choice.  Wine by the bottle was at an even higher than usual markup (close to 5x retail), but wines by the glass were reasonable (within the context of a high priced steak house).

data.title: Poor example of a high-end restaurant
data.text:
Want some advice? Go to Capital Grill; this place is awful.

My partner received a coupon via email for Morton's special $35 2-lb lobsters, so we decided to go.

Our food:

Complimentary Foccacia bread: Stale. No joke. You know how bread gets a little extra white inside when it starts to become stale? And it gets crusty? This had those white edges, and it was crusty, and they heated it up in the oven in an attempt to mask it. So dry it was like eating a puffy saltine cracker. I mean, how do you f- up bread? 

Appetizers: "Tuna Tower" I would not call a 3-story-tall building a "tower." This thing stood a whopping 3" tall, and only 1/3 of it was Tuna. The other 2/3 were made up of a crushed wasabi cracker and Mango salsa. I admit, it was delicious. But I was certainly expecting much more with the name "Tuna Tower" and for $18.50. Want an idea of the size of it? I think they used a 1-cup measuring cup as a mold for it. So, take out your 1-cup measuring cup: that's about the size. And while the chips served with it were delicious, there were not enough of them.

Oysters: 6 for $18. They didn't come with mignonette sauce. 3 of them weren't separated from the shell (they weren't shucked correctly), and 3 of them were sandy.

Drinks: FYI, most of the cocktails are around $15.

Baked potato: We split one. It was luke-warm, looked like it had been sitting under a heat-lamp for an hour, and cost $13. Most of the sides were out-of-the-can friendly: creamed corn; creamed spinach; mushrooms. I'm not sure if they come out of a can or not, but the sides available on the menu seemed un-creative, un-inspiring, and not worthy of their price tag. Can't believe we paid $13 for a baked potato.

Lobsters: The tails were over-cooked, claws tasted good, tamale inside was very liquidy, and not sure if they were 2-lbs.

Dessert: We skipped it because we were anticipating bland, over-priced dessert that had been sitting in a freezer all day.

I gave 2 stars because it is a pretty dining room, the hostesses were amiable, and the server, while his demeanor was a bit informal for a high-end restaurant, worked hard and wanted us to be satisfied.

Upon leaving, we passed a table where we noticed a lobster and baked potato that were noticeably larger than our's.

In the end, our bill was $180 including tip. I felt like I had been ripped off.

data.title: Spend the money somewhere else
data.text: Customer service apparently isn't the strongpoint. Service from waiter (Anthony) was short, abrupt, a bit arrogant, and lacking. For the price, there should be better quality. Food was decent but I would expect that at $50+ for a steak. Steak wasn't cooked how I wanted it the first time. Had to send back. Unlikely I that I will go back. Didn't get the value for my money.

data.title: Disapointing service
data.text: I have been here before and the service and food were excellent, however this time the server was snippy and non-attentive.  The steaks were over cooked.  Our guests were uncomfortable and this was a very unpleasant business dinner.  this was also the last time will go there.

data.title: Vegetarians At A Steak House?
data.text:
Why?

Yes, why would long, long time vegetarians regularly visit one of the top (maybe THE TOP) steak house in Fort Lauderdale?

Not really that complicated.

We enjoy meeting several of our omnivore associates and friends of this centrally located restaurant for Happy Hour spot in downtown Fort Lauderdale.  

Aside from the slightly above average of happy hour wine offerings, the decedent crispy potato sticks are tossed with grated parmesan cheese, salt and chopped fresh parsley and topped off with ample amounts of truffle oil!  Fabulous!

Lastly, but perhaps most importantly, the carrot cake is like no other!  The astronomically high caloric and fat intake requires several offsetting hours of high intensity cardio gym work.....but what is life if not a balance between evil and good!

data.title: The Best Morton's in South Florida
data.text: Not all Morton's are created equal.  If you have a choice between the Morton's in North Miami Beach, Ft. Lauderdale, Boca, and West Palm, choose Ft. Lauderdale.  The layout of the restaurant is superior, the service is superb, and the steaks are perfectly prepared and presented.  Nothing but 5-stars for this Morton's.

data.title: excellent
data.text: Steak is to die for. The mac and cheese is the best. Everything is really good. Even the chips and blue cheese dip lol. It is a littles expensive but it is worth it‼️

data.title: Worst Steak house meal and experience
data.text:
Had a 7:30 PM reservation for two, my wife's Birthday
Arrived on time and was seated at a booth right next to the kitchen service door and counter.
There were at least 4 other booths that were empty, the booth we were given should be reserved for people that come late or are inappropriately dressed or?
We ordered and watched our food served through the serving shelf , part of our meal was dropped on the floor in our full view, we were half way through our meal when it finally came to our table. The steak my wife ordered was tasteless and so were my crab cakes.
We were so upset that we left half our meal and paid for our dinner and left.
No one was at the reception area to complain to.
We are full time residents of Florida and dine out several times a week.
It seems that the snow birds get better service for the few months a year they are in Florida although we support these restaurants all year long.
We will never dine at Morton's again.
